meanings.definition: The quality of being easily excited or stimulated.
meanings.sent1: Her excitablenesses made her jump with joy at the slightest surprise.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's excitablenesses were evident as he wagged his tail at the sound of his owner's voice.
meanings.sent3: The excitablenesses of the toddler led to a hilarious reaction when presented with a new toy.
meanings.sent4: His excitablenesses were like a spring waiting to be released, always on the edge of bursting with energy.
meanings.sent5: The excitablenesses of the crowd grew as the performer took the stage, creating a buzz of anticipation.

meanings.definition: The state of being responsive to stimuli.
meanings.sent1: The plant's excitablenesses were evident as it turned towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: His excitablenesses in conversation made him a great listener, always attentive to others.
meanings.sent3: The excitablenesses of the cat to the sound of a can opener was both amusing and predictable.
meanings.sent4: Her excitablenesses to music was like a dance waiting to happen, always ready to move to the beat.
meanings.sent5: The excitablenesses of the alarm system made it react instantly to any movement, ensuring security.
